headline: Northeast Ohio politicians react to President Biden's State of the Union address
sentences:
Here's what some of Northeast Ohio's top elected officials had to say about the president's address:
"Tonight, Ohioans heard the most pro-worker president in our lifetime reaffirm his commitment to put workers at the center of our economy, and his commitment to stand up for American values and up to Putin and autocrats everywhere.

"And I waited for the President to show some empathy for tired and frustrated parents who have spent the last two years fighting rogue schoolboards, hostile teachers' unions, and out-of-touch politicians who put their ideological wants ahead of the educational needs of our children.

"I waited for President Biden to show he really understands what it’s like for working Americans who are seeing skyrocketing inflation…where more and more of their take home pay evaporates at the gas station and grocery store as a direct result of policies that he’s put in place.

#sotu
— Rep. Bob Gibbs (@RepBobGibbs) March 2, 2022
How can we take you seriously on this when your admin called parents protesting Covid restrictions and critical race theory “domestic terrorists” and tried to unleash the @FBI on them?

More spending is not the solution to rising prices!#SOTU
— Congressman Troy Balderson (@RepBalderson) March 2, 2022
Rising overdose deaths and illegal crossings are symptoms of the neglected problems at the border.

While some line up to vote against the Middle Class and cozy up to autocrats, President Biden and Congressional Democrats will continue fighting for the American people and our precious values around the globe."

Biden spent a great deal of time discussing the ongoing crisis in Ukraine, repeating the near-universal condemnation from both the United States and the remainder of the West of Russia's invasion of the country.

But thankfully, Europe, led by Germany, is reversing course - announcing the construction of new LNG import terminals, stockpiling oil and coal, and turning back on the nuclear power they recently shut off.

https://t.co/AYADXj2ns5
— Dave Joyce (@RepDaveJoyce) March 2, 2022
We must move forward with the CHIPS Act so our country can independently manufacture technology that is critical for our everyday lives!

The president announced he would be closing the U.S.'s airspace to all Russian planes, and his overall remarks on the situation received large amounts of applause from Democrats and Republicans alike.
The speech then turned to domestic issues, with Biden once again touting his proposed "Build Back Better" legislation along with goals on things like voting rights, health care, and immigration.
I’ll be watching the President closely to see if he continues advocating for policy changes and action on these critically important issues once the bright lights of the State of the Union fade.

We all know it: The road to winning our future goes straight through Ohio.#SOTU
— Congressman Tim Ryan (@RepTimRyan) March 2, 2022
Tonight, we brought toxic burn pits to the world stage.

https://t.co/27HWgJm0Bm
— Rep. Bob Gibbs (@RepBobGibbs) March 2, 2022
"The American people elected Joe Biden president because they know his heart and they knew he would fight for them.
"At home, the pandemic is receding and the economy is growing because of the American Rescue Plan, which got shots into arms, money into families’ pockets, and workers back on the job.
By unleashing our domestic oil and gas production we can help lower global CO2 emissions, stop importing 538,000 barrels of Russian oil every day, and weaken Putin’s position of power.

— Rep. Shontel Brown (@RepShontelBrown) March 2, 2022
Standing with Ukraine must also mean restoring American #EnergyIndependence and halting the flow of money into Putin's war chest.

#SOTU
— Congressman Troy Balderson (@RepBalderson) March 2, 2022
For years we were told that if we cut taxes for the rich, it’ll trickle down to communities like Youngstown.
In the midst of the worst pandemic in a century, President Biden passed the American Rescue Plan to keep hospitals and schools open, and police and firefighters on the job.
"So tonight, I waited for President Biden to announce America's return to energy independence given the abundance of oil, natural gas and coal trapped under our feet.
President Biden has united the free world against Russia’s invasion, and tonight members of both parties stood together in solidarity with the people of Ukraine.
After many had tried, President Biden delivered an infrastructure bill that will breathe new life into communities and support millions of good-paying jobs.
It’s a privilege to have helped lead this charge with my bill named after SFC Heath Robinson, whose wife Danielle was honored during the #SOTU tonight.
We will invest in American innovation and rebuild our industrial base, to bring critical supply chains home to the U.S. and better compete with China.
And we will work to lower costs for American families – from taking on corporate price gouging, to lowering the cost of energy and prescription drugs.

https://t.co/At1HC2AHGA
— Dave Joyce (@RepDaveJoyce) March 2, 2022
To lower #energy prices for Americans, @POTUS must end his war on American energy.
@intel’s investment in Ohio and its #manufacturing base is the largest single private sector company investment in the history of the Buckeye State.

#StandWithUkraine
— Congressman Troy Balderson (@RepBalderson) March 2, 2022
Today's inflation numbers are the worst we've seen in nearly 40 years.
He’s a year late and at odds with many in his party on these issues; his reversal on these critical issues, if sincere, will be a welcome change.

#SOTU
— Rep. Shontel Brown (@RepShontelBrown) March 2, 2022
Shaneice Ball, a mother of three from Cleveland, is my guest for tonight’s #sotu .
As expected, reaction to these words was split mostly along party lines, and provided a possible preview for this year's midterm elections.
"The president laid out a vision where all workers can get a good-paying job, keep up with the cost of living, and join the middle class.
CLEVELAND — Tuesday night in Washington, President Biden delivered his first official State of the Union address since taking office.
With the passage of the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, we will create jobs and move goods faster and cheaper.

#SOTU
— Dave Joyce (@RepDaveJoyce) March 2, 2022
Supporting those in recovery for substance use disorder is absolutely critical.
We MUST stand strong with #Ukraine and we can start by ending imports of Russian oil and developing our own domestic resources.
Two years ago, unemployment was skyrocketing, infrastructure was crumbling, and our global alliances had been torn to shreds.
It will generate more than 20,000 jobs and will increase America's share of the global #semiconductor supply chain ????

#SOTU
— Congressman Tim Ryan (@RepTimRyan) March 2, 2022
It’s no coincidence how much Ohio is being brought up tonight.
That includes cutting off the flow of illegal drugs like fentanyl coming into our country from China and Mexico.
A reminder of what’s possible when we have the guts to take on China by investing in our workers here at home.
Now, when the fate of Liberty is on the line, President Biden is leading the world for the defense of Ukraine.
"I heard him vaguely tell the American people that he supports funding the police and securing our borders.
The president attempted to sell his domestic agenda, but events abroad loomed large over the speech.
Tonight, I was hoping to hear more specifics and solutions that would work…but I was disappointed."
Europe’s rush to green energy policies have put the continent under the thumb of Vladimir Putin.
I was listening for an admission that his way wasn’t working and possible course corrections.
In Ohio, we’re taking the lead with @intel to produce semiconductor chips on American soil.
As is combatting the record-breaking amount of fentanyl flowing across our souther border.
I will work with him and with colleagues of both parties to make that vision a reality."
"Bottom line - President Biden's policies have so far created one crisis after another.
Instead, he talked vaguely about 'environmental justice' and 'weatherizing' our homes.

— Rep. Shontel Brown (@RepShontelBrown) March 2, 2022
Lower prescription drug prices.

#SOTU
— Congressman Tim Ryan (@RepTimRyan) March 2, 2022
"Beat the opioid epidemic."
@POTUS is right: it’s time to extend this critical lifeline for American families.
Neither will fuel our economy, reduce inflation, or keep a brutal dictator at bay.
She relied on the Child Tax Credit to pay rent and make ends meet for her family.

Rob Portman (R)
"These are serious times both here at home and around the world.
But his policies helped to create America’s crime crisis and our border crisis.
"Most of the world now understands that energy security is national security.

https://t.co/ZOGRej5acj
— Congressman Tim Ryan (@RepTimRyan) March 2, 2022
.
And tonight, I didn’t hear a speech that met the challenges of this moment.

#SOTU
— Congressman Tim Ryan (@RepTimRyan) March 2, 2022
$20 billion.
It’s time we make the economy work for working people again.
Americans are paying more and earning less across the board.
No more infrastructure weeks—now it’s infrastructure decade.
+ millions of dollars more that will be felt across Ohio.
People have talked about infrastructure for generations.
Glad @POTUS is FINALLY acknowledging the #BorderCrisis.
— Governor Mike DeWine (@GovMikeDeWine) March 2, 2022
It’s a partnership that will transform our nation.
Please take a moment and listen to Heath’s story.
Now, it's time to pass the "Finish the Wall Act!"
That’s how we lower costs for American families.
7,000 good-paying, union construction jobs.
3,000 good-paying manufacturing jobs.
Last year we actually got it done.
But all we got was lip service.
And we’re just getting started.
Extend the child tax credit.
@POTUS knows it, I know it.
We can and must do both.
But it never happened.
Cut childcare costs.
They were wrong.
U.S. Sen.
